Posts.Content: jazzydog2 wrote: I was diagnosed and treated in late 2004 and 2005 - lumpectomy, 1 positive node, 12 nodes removed, chemo and radiation.  Since then I have been on Taxmoifen and now Aromasin.  Lately and just very infrequently, I have felt a rather intense pain on the side of the surgery  just below the armpit.  This has occurred maybe three times over the last 6 months - intense pain like when you have a "stitch" in your side, but more painful for a brief duration and then it's gone.  My onc told me that I should watch for continuous pain for over 2 weeks as a warning sign.  Just wondering if anyone has any wisdom on this for me? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hpw do you know when pain = recurrence jazzydog2 ozzie2

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 11:50AM jazzydog2 wrote: Thanks all of you.  Once again this community has been a source of information and assistance.  So nice to be able to share our concerns. Sheila
Posts.Title: Hpw do you know when pain = recurrence jazzydog2 ozzie2

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 02:55PM jazzydog2 wrote: Member - that's what mine is as well - it goes away for long periods of time.  That's what makes me think this is not a recurrence - I think my onc said to come in if there is continuous pain for 2 weeks or more.  This is definitely not continuous.
